title: Santander Picks Insider as Next CEO
sub_head: Héctor Grisi will take over as several of the Spanish bank’s markets face economic uncertainty over high inflation
body:
Banco Santander SA named its head of Mexico and North America operations as its new chief executive, as the Spanish bank braces for a period of economic uncertainty in many of its markets.
Héctor Grisi joined Santander in 2015 as head of its Mexico unit, and in 2019 added the role of North American head. In those jobs he has cut costs and increased customers in Mexico, and he turned a struggling unit in the U.S. into the largest contributor to profit in the group last year.
